clusters.title: Is this finally rock bottom for Mr Andrew Mountbatten Windsor?
clusters.neutral_headline: Prince Andrew Stripped of Titles, Evicted from Residence
bullet_summary: King Charles' brother, Prince Andrew, is being stripped of his royal titles, Buckingham Palace announced Thursday
King Charles announced he will remove his brother’s royal titles after growing pressure about Andrew’s connection to Jeffrey Epstein
King Charles III will strip his younger brother Andrew of his royal titles and long-term residence, the palace said in a statement on Thursday
"Prince Andrew will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor," it said, adding that he would also move out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle's sprawling grounds

items.title: Is this finally rock bottom for Mr Andrew Mountbatten Windsor?
items.standfirst: Stripping Andrew of the title 'prince' is colossal, says the BBC's royal correspondent Sean Coughlan.
items.content: Stripping Andrew of the title 'prince' is colossal, says the BBC's royal correspondent Sean Coughlan.

items.title: The Papers: 'The Andrew formerly known as Prince' and 'meet Mr Windsor'
items.standfirst: The Royal announcement that Andrew will be stripped of the title of "prince" dominates Friday's papers.
items.content: The Royal announcement that Andrew will be stripped of the title of "prince" dominates Friday's papers.

items.title: Prince Andrew to lose real estate, titles, in unprecedented move from Buckingham Palace
items.standfirst: King Charles' brother, Prince Andrew, is being stripped of his royal titles, Buckingham Palace announced Thursday. He will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab and Julian Payne have more.
items.content: King Charles' brother, Prince Andrew, is being stripped of his royal titles, Buckingham Palace announced Thursday. He will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab and Julian Payne have more.

items.title: Prince Andrew stripped of royal titles amid mounting pressure
items.standfirst: King Charles announced he will remove his brother’s royal titles after growing pressure about Andrew’s connection to Jeffrey Epstein. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports from Buckingham Palace.
items.content: King Charles announced he will remove his brother’s royal titles after growing pressure about Andrew’s connection to Jeffrey Epstein. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports from Buckingham Palace.

items.title: King Charles strips Andrew of prince title and ejects him from mansion
items.standfirst: Royal subject to ‘censures deemed necessary’ in sharp change of tone by Buckingham Palace
items.content: Royal subject to ‘censures deemed necessary’ in sharp change of tone by Buckingham Palace

items.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles, evicts him from royal home
items.standfirst: The rare move comes after mounting pressure to act over Andrew's relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
items.content: The rare move comes after mounting pressure to act over Andrew's relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: 'A huge fall from grace': Prince Andrew stripped of title, residence in wake of Epstein scandal
items.standfirst: FRANCE 24's Bénédicte Paviot reports from London as Buckingham Palace announces that Prince Andrew has been stripped of his remaining titles and told to leave his royal residence. She says that the Royal Family is determined to distance itself from the 'endless headlines about Prince Andrew's links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein'.
items.content: FRANCE 24's Bénédicte Paviot reports from London as Buckingham Palace announces that Prince Andrew has been stripped of his remaining titles and told to leave his royal residence. She says that the Royal Family is determined to distance itself from the 'endless headlines about Prince Andrew's links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein'.

items.title: King's statement on Andrew in full
items.standfirst: The King's brother loses his title of prince and will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.
items.content: The King's brother loses his title of prince and will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.

items.title: King Charles to strip Andrew of royal titles, residence: Buckingham Palace
items.standfirst: King Charles III will strip his younger brother Andrew of his royal titles and long-term residence, the palace said in a statement on Thursday. "Prince Andrew will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor," it said, adding that he would also move out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle's sprawling grounds. The announcement followed fresh outrage at accusations made against him by one of Jeffrey Epstein's main accusers.
items.content: King Charles III will strip his younger brother Andrew of his royal titles and long-term residence, the palace said in a statement on Thursday. "Prince Andrew will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor," it said, adding that he would also move out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle's sprawling grounds. The announcement followed fresh outrage at accusations made against him by one of Jeffrey Epstein's main accusers.

items.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of his titles and evicts him from the Royal Lodge
items.standfirst: Buckingham Palace said the king's brother will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince, and he will move from his Royal Lodge residence into "private accommodation."
items.content: Buckingham Palace said the king's brother will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince, and he will move from his Royal Lodge residence into "private accommodation."(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)

items.title: King Charles to remove Prince Andrew's royal titles and honours, Buckingham Palace says
items.standfirst: Britain's King Charles III will revoke the remaining royal titles and honours from his brother Prince Andrew, Buckingham Palace said Thursday. The prince had earlier surrendered his use of the title Duke of York under mounting pressure due to his friendship with deceased sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
items.content: Britain's King Charles III will revoke the remaining royal titles and honours from his brother Prince Andrew, Buckingham Palace said Thursday. The prince had earlier surrendered his use of the title Duke of York under mounting pressure due to his friendship with deceased sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: King Charles to remove Prince Andrew's titles and eject him from the Royal Lodge
items.standfirst: Britain's Prince Andrew will have his royal titles formally removed and will move out of his home in Windsor, Buckingham Palace said Thursday, as the royal faces growing pressure over his ties to the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
items.content: Britain's Prince Andrew will have his royal titles formally removed and will move out of his home in Windsor, Buckingham Palace said Thursday, as the royal faces growing pressure over his ties to the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein

ai_summary: King Charles removed Prince Andrew's royal titles, Buckingham Palace announced.
Andrew will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.
The move follows mounting pressure regarding Andrew's association with Jeffrey Epstein.
Andrew was also told to leave his royal residence.
The Royal Family aims to distance itself from Andrew's Epstein-related controversies.

clusters.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll nears 50 as Jamaica relief efforts intensify and storm heads north
clusters.neutral_headline: Hurricane Melissa Death Toll Rises, Heads Toward Bermuda
bullet_summary: In Haiti, the death toll has risen to 30, with another 20 missing, the civil defence agency said on Thursday
Hurricane Melissa’s death toll rose to 49 on Thursday after it tore through the northern Caribbean and gained strength en route to Bermuda, officials said
Jamaica’s information minister said at least 19 people were confirmed dead there as authorities continued search and rescue operations across the island
The scale of the destruction left by Hurricane Melissa as it tore across Jamaica is now being revealed by the first photos taken by satellites

items.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll nears 50 as Jamaica relief efforts intensify and storm heads north
items.standfirst: Haiti death toll reaches 30, and 19 in Jamaica, as Bermuda weathers tropical storm conditions on Thursday nightThe death toll from Hurricane Melissa has reached 49 as the storm continued to tear through the Caribbean, heading past Bermuda, and workers in Jamaica ramped up efforts to clear roads and reach people in isolated and cut-off areas.In Haiti, the death toll has risen to 30, with another 20 missing, the civil defence agency said on Thursday. A further 20 people were injured, it added. Continue reading...
items.content: Haiti death toll reaches 30, and 19 in Jamaica, as Bermuda weathers tropical storm conditions on Thursday nightThe death toll from Hurricane Melissa has reached 49 as the storm continued to tear through the Caribbean, heading past Bermuda, and workers in Jamaica ramped up efforts to clear roads and reach people in isolated and cut-off areas.In Haiti, the death toll has risen to 30, with another 20 missing, the civil defence agency said on Thursday. A further 20 people were injured, it added. Continue reading...

items.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll rises as storm strengthens toward Bermuda
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa’s death toll rose to 49 on Thursday after it tore through the northern Caribbean and gained strength en route to Bermuda, officials said. Jamaica’s information minister said at least 19 people were confirmed dead there as authorities continued search and rescue operations across the island.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa’s death toll rose to 49 on Thursday after it tore through the northern Caribbean and gained strength en route to Bermuda, officials said. Jamaica’s information minister said at least 19 people were confirmed dead there as authorities continued search and rescue operations across the island.

items.title: At least 28 dead as Hurricane Melissa leaves Jamaica, Haiti, Cuba reeling
items.standfirst: People across the northern Caribbean were digging out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa​ on Thursday as deaths from the catastrophic storm climbed.
items.content: People across the northern Caribbean were digging out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa​ on Thursday as deaths from the catastrophic storm climbed.

items.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
items.standfirst: Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication.
items.content: Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication. (Image credit: Matias Delacroix)

items.title: Destruction in Jamaica revealed in before and after satellite images

items.content: The scale of the destruction left by Hurricane Melissa as it tore across Jamaica is now being revealed by the first photos taken by satellites.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves a recovery challenge for the Caribbean after more than 30 dead
items.standfirst: The storm was making its way to the Bahamas and Bermuda Thursday morning after killing at least seven in Jamaica and 27 more across the Caribbean this week.
items.content: The storm was making its way to the Bahamas and Bermuda Thursday morning after killing at least seven in Jamaica and 27 more across the Caribbean this week.

ai_summary: Hurricane Melissa's death toll reached 49 as it moved through the Caribbean.
The storm is gaining strength as it approaches Bermuda.
At least 19 deaths were confirmed in Jamaica.
Haiti's death toll reached 30, with 20 missing.
Communities are dealing with the aftermath, lacking homes and power.

items.title: Trade takeaways from President Trump’s meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping
items.standfirst: BANGKOK — U.S. President Donald Trump said he had an “amazing” meeting Thursday with China’s top leader Xi Jinping that produced very important decisions. The first official Chinese comments on the meeting were less specific and suggested any trade deal is not done. Trump met with Xi on the…

The first official Chinese comments on the meeting were less specific and suggested any trade deal is not done. Trump met with Xi on the…

items.title: Here's what Trump says he and Xi agreed to in their meeting
items.standfirst: President Trump said the U.S. and China reached deals on several items, including a short-term agreement on rare-earth minerals, and soybean sales to China.
items.content: President Trump said the U.S. and China reached deals on several items, including a short-term agreement on rare-earth minerals, and soybean sales to China.

items.title: Trump reaches trade war truce with China
items.standfirst: President Trump reached a trade war truce with China’s President Xi in their high-stakes meeting. President Trump agreed to lower some tariffs on Chinese imports in exchange for China suspending restrictions on rare-earth minerals, stopping the flow of fentanyl into the U.S., and buying more soybeans from American farmers. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: President Trump reached a trade war truce with China’s President Xi in their high-stakes meeting. President Trump agreed to lower some tariffs on Chinese imports in exchange for China suspending restrictions on rare-earth minerals, stopping the flow of fentanyl into the U.S., and buying more soybeans from American farmers. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: Trump-Xi meeting brought back 'relative calm' on trade, expert says
items.standfirst: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Rana Mitter, S.T. Lee Chair in US - Asia relations at the Harvard Kennedy School, says that the meeting between US president Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping has managed to restore 'a relative calm' in terms of trade.
items.content: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Rana Mitter, S.T. Lee Chair in US - Asia relations at the Harvard Kennedy School, says that the meeting between US president Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping has managed to restore 'a relative calm' in terms of trade.

items.title: Tariff cuts, soybeans, rare earths exports: Trade takeaways from Trump-Xi meeting
items.standfirst: From the lowering of US tariffs on Chinese goods to an agreement by Beijing not to tighten restrictions on rare earths exports, the meeting between President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping Thursday was a "great success", the US leader said. While China has not officially commented on the specifics of the agreements, here are some key takeaways of the talks, according to US officials.
items.content: From the lowering of US tariffs on Chinese goods to an agreement by Beijing not to tighten restrictions on rare earths exports, the meeting between President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping Thursday was a "great success", the US leader said. While China has not officially commented on the specifics of the agreements, here are some key takeaways of the talks, according to US officials.

items.title: Xi-Trump meeting: America has discovered that bullies can be bullied back
items.standfirst: Outcome appears closer to truce than durable peace but outline of broader diplomatic relationship is visibleFive key takeaways from Trump-Xi meetingWhen Donald Trump launched his trade war against China in April, threatening tariffs as high as 145%, the Chinese government said it would never bow to blackmail and vowed to “fight to the end”.The question now is whether the consensus reached between Trump and Xi Jinping in Busan, South Korea, on Thursday means that the fight really has come to an end, and if so on whose terms. Continue reading...
items.content: Outcome appears closer to truce than durable peace but outline of broader diplomatic relationship is visibleFive key takeaways from Trump-Xi meetingWhen Donald Trump launched his trade war against China in April, threatening tariffs as high as 145%, the Chinese government said it would never bow to blackmail and vowed to “fight to the end”.The question now is whether the consensus reached between Trump and Xi Jinping in Busan, South Korea, on Thursday means that the fight really has come to an end, and if so on whose terms. Continue reading...

items.title: What Trump and Xi did and didn't agree upon in their meeting
items.standfirst: From fentanyl to rare earths, President Donald Trump’s highly anticipated meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping saw the world’s two biggest economies ease their trade tensions, or at least some of them.
items.content: From fentanyl to rare earths, President Donald Trump’s highly anticipated meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping saw the world’s two biggest economies ease their trade tensions, or at least some of them.

items.title: Trump-Xi meeting: US president says rare earths deal and tariff cut agreed
items.standfirst: Donald Trump hails ‘amazing’ trade talks with Chinese counterpart, with ‘no roadblock at all on rare earth’Five key takeaways from Trump-Xi meetingAnalysis: price of confrontation was too high for both sidesDonald Trump has described crucial trade talks with the Chinese president in South Korea as “amazing”, saying their dispute over the supply of rare earths had been settled and that he would visit China in April.Xi Jinping has not commented on Thursday’s discussions but noted that the economic and trade teams from both countries had “reached a basic consensus on addressing our respective major concerns” during recent talks in Kuala Lumpur, according to Chinese state media. That had “provided the necessary conditions” for their meeting on Thursday, he added. Continue reading...
items.content: Donald Trump hails ‘amazing’ trade talks with Chinese counterpart, with ‘no roadblock at all on rare earth’Five key takeaways from Trump-Xi meetingAnalysis: price of confrontation was too high for both sidesDonald Trump has described crucial trade talks with the Chinese president in South Korea as “amazing”, saying their dispute over the supply of rare earths had been settled and that he would visit China in April.Xi Jinping has not commented on Thursday’s discussions but noted that the economic and trade teams from both countries had “reached a basic consensus on addressing our respective major concerns” during recent talks in Kuala Lumpur, according to Chinese state media. That had “provided the necessary conditions” for their meeting on Thursday, he added. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump lowers fentanyl tariffs on China, while Xi delays rare earth export controls
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will meet in Busan, South Korea, to discuss tariffs, fentanyl and rare-earth minerals.
items.content: President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will meet in Busan, South Korea, to discuss tariffs, fentanyl and rare-earth minerals.

ai_summary: Trump and Xi Jinping met, discussing trade and tariffs.
Trump said they reached deals on several items.
China agreed to buy more soybeans from American farmers.
The US agreed to lower some tariffs on Chinese imports.
Experts say the meeting restored relative calm in trade relations.

items.standfirst: Massive Ultra-Orthodox Rally In Israel Protests Arrest Of Draft Dodgers Via The Cradle Hundreds of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Israelis, known as the Haredim, gathered in Jerusalem on Thursday for a mass rally against the arrests of yeshiva students accused of evading military service. The rally…
items.content: Massive Ultra-Orthodox Rally In Israel Protests Arrest Of Draft Dodgers Via The Cradle Hundreds of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Israelis, known as the Haredim, gathered in Jerusalem on Thursday for a mass rally against the arrests of yeshiva students accused of evading military service. The rally…

items.title: Israel’s ultra-Orthodox rally in ‘March of the Million’ against army service
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox men packed the entrance to Jerusalem on Thursday, protesting government plans to draft them into the military. Chanting and waving signs saying they would rather go to jail, demonstrators highlighted a growing rift over exemptions that threatens Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.
items.content: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox men packed the entrance to Jerusalem on Thursday, protesting government plans to draft them into the military. Chanting and waving signs saying they would rather go to jail, demonstrators highlighted a growing rift over exemptions that threatens Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.

items.title: 'Better to go to prison': Israeli ultra-Orthodox rally against army service
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Jewish men rallied in Jerusalem on Thursday to protest against military conscription in their community, an issue that has caused a major strain in Israel's right-wing ruling coalition. The vast crowd were demonstrating to demand a law guaranteeing their right to avoid Israel's mandatory military service -- long promised by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.
items.content: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Jewish men rallied in Jerusalem on Thursday to protest against military conscription in their community, an issue that has caused a major strain in Israel's right-wing ruling coalition. The vast crowd were demonstrating to demand a law guaranteeing their right to avoid Israel's mandatory military service -- long promised by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

items.title: Israeli ultra-Orthodox Jews rally in Jerusalem against military service
items.standfirst: Approximately 200,000 people took part in the protest, bringing West Jerusalem to a standstill, local media reported.
items.content: Approximately 200,000 people took part in the protest, bringing West Jerusalem to a standstill, local media reported.

items.title: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Israelis protest against conscription
items.standfirst: Demonstrators take to the streets over changes to an exemption from military service in one of the biggest protests of its kind for years.
items.content: Demonstrators take to the streets over changes to an exemption from military service in one of the biggest protests of its kind for years.

ai_summary: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis protested against the arrest of draft dodgers.
Tens of thousands rallied in Jerusalem against military conscription.
Protesters demanded a law guaranteeing exemption from service.
The protest caused a major strain in the ruling coalition.
Approximately 200,000 people participated in the protest.

clusters.title: Trump caps refugee admissions at record low - with most to be white South Africans
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Sets Record Low Refugee Admission Cap
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, France24, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Trump caps refugee admissions at record low - with most to be white South Africans
items.standfirst: The president sets the limit at 7,500 for the coming year, a dramatic cut from 125,000.
items.content: The president sets the limit at 7,500 for the coming year, a dramatic cut from 125,000.

items.title: Trump caps refugee admissions to record low, prioritising white South Africans
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Thursday said it would slash the number of refugees admitted to the United States to a record low of 7,500 for fiscal year 2026, down from more than 100,000 under president Joe Biden, while prioritising applicants from white South African communities.
items.content: The Trump administration on Thursday said it would slash the number of refugees admitted to the United States to a record low of 7,500 for fiscal year 2026, down from more than 100,000 under president Joe Biden, while prioritising applicants from white South African communities.

items.title: Trump announces lowest refugee admission cap in US history at 7,500
items.standfirst: President says US will prioritise white South Africans in move decried by refugee advocates as blatantly political.
items.content: President says US will prioritise white South Africans in move decried by refugee advocates as blatantly political.

items.title: Trump administration sets lowest-ever cap on refugee admissions to U.S.
items.standfirst: The lowest cap on refugees since the program was established in 1980 comes as the U.S. prioritizes resettling Afrikaners from South Africa.
items.content: The lowest cap on refugees since the program was established in 1980 comes as the U.S. prioritizes resettling Afrikaners from South Africa.(Image credit: Farooq Naeem)

ai_summary: The Trump administration set a record low refugee admission cap.
The cap is set at 7,500 for the coming fiscal year.
The administration will prioritize white South Africans.
This is the lowest cap since the program began in 1980.
Refugee advocates decried the move as political.

items.title: Senate passes bill to nullify Trump’s sweeping global tariffs on more than 100 nations – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.Trump news at a glance: Four Senate Republicans join Democrats to reject global tariffsIn the days leading up to the Trump-Xi meeting, American officials signalled that the US president did not intend to make good on a recent threat to impose an additional 100% import tax on Chinese goods.Also that China had shown signs it is willing to relax its export controls on rare earths as well as revive buying soybeans from the US.The relationship with China is very good.Because of the tremendous destructive power, I HATED to do it, but had no choice! Russia is second, and China is a distant third, but will be even within 5 years.Because of other countries testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.Trump news at a glance: Four Senate Republicans join Democrats to reject global tariffsIn the days leading up to the Trump-Xi meeting, American officials signalled that the US president did not intend to make good on a recent threat to impose an additional 100% import tax on Chinese goods.Also that China had shown signs it is willing to relax its export controls on rare earths as well as revive buying soybeans from the US.The relationship with China is very good.Because of the tremendous destructive power, I HATED to do it, but had no choice! Russia is second, and China is a distant third, but will be even within 5 years.Because of other countries testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. items.title: 4 GOP senators join Democrats to rebuke Trump on tariffs for a third time this week
items.standfirst: A handful of Republicans joined Democrats to vote against President Trump's emergency tariffs against Brazil, Canada and other countries. But the votes were mostly symbolic and unlikely to become law.
items.content: A handful of Republicans joined Democrats to vote against President Trump's emergency tariffs against Brazil, Canada and other countries. But the votes were mostly symbolic and unlikely to become law.(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)

items.title: US Senate votes to reject Trump’s global tariffs on more than 100 countries
items.standfirst: Vote passes 51-47 in latest bipartisan effort to challenge tariffs, but House is unlikely to take any similar actionThe US Senate took a stand against Donald Trump’s global tariffs affecting more than 100 countries on Thursday, voting to nullify the so-called “reciprocal” tariffs.Four Republicans joined with all Democrats to vote 51-47 on a resolution to end the base-level tariffs that the president put into place via executive order. Continue reading...
items.content: Vote passes 51-47 in latest bipartisan effort to challenge tariffs, but House is unlikely to take any similar actionThe US Senate took a stand against Donald Trump’s global tariffs affecting more than 100 countries on Thursday, voting to nullify the so-called “reciprocal” tariffs.Four Republicans joined with all Democrats to vote 51-47 on a resolution to end the base-level tariffs that the president put into place via executive order. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to match Russia and China in nuclear weapons testing
items.standfirst: US president makes threat after Russian nuclear-powered weapons tests and shortly before meeting with Chinese leaderDonald Trump has instructed the Pentagon to immediately start matching other nuclear powers in their testing of nuclear weapons, specifically citing Russia and China.In a post to Truth Social, Trump said “because of other countries’ testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president makes threat after Russian nuclear-powered weapons tests and shortly before meeting with Chinese leaderDonald Trump has instructed the Pentagon to immediately start matching other nuclear powers in their testing of nuclear weapons, specifically citing Russia and China.In a post to Truth Social, Trump said “because of other countries’ testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately.” Continue reading...

items.title: Four feet higher and rising: Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia becomes world’s tallest church
items.standfirst: Antoni Gaudí’s masterwork is still under construction but now stands taller than Ulm Minster in southern GermanyBarcelona’s Sagrada Familia basilica became the world’s tallest church on Thursday after a part of its central tower was lifted into place.The masterwork of the architect Antoni Gaudí now rises to 162.91 metres (534ft 8in) above the city, the church said in a statement. That beats the spire of Ulm Minster in Germany, which tops out at 161.53 metres. Continue reading...
items.content: Antoni Gaudí’s masterwork is still under construction but now stands taller than Ulm Minster in southern GermanyBarcelona’s Sagrada Familia basilica became the world’s tallest church on Thursday after a part of its central tower was lifted into place.The masterwork of the architect Antoni Gaudí now rises to 162.91 metres (534ft 8in) above the city, the church said in a statement. That beats the spire of Ulm Minster in Germany, which tops out at 161.53 metres. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel strikes Gaza again after overnight bombardment that killed at least 104
items.standfirst: Attacks shatter Palestinians’ short-lived relief since start of ceasefire that now looks increasingly fragileIsrael carried out another strike in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, killing at least two people, after bombarding the territory overnight and killing at least 104 Palestinians, including children, in the gravest challenge yet to the increasingly fragile US-brokered ceasefire. The Israeli military said it had struck military infrastructure where weapons were being stored for an imminent attack in Beit Lahia, northern Gaza. Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza City said it had received two bodies from the strike. Continue reading...
items.content: Attacks shatter Palestinians’ short-lived relief since start of ceasefire that now looks increasingly fragileIsrael carried out another strike in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, killing at least two people, after bombarding the territory overnight and killing at least 104 Palestinians, including children, in the gravest challenge yet to the increasingly fragile US-brokered ceasefire. The Israeli military said it had struck military infrastructure where weapons were being stored for an imminent attack in Beit Lahia, northern Gaza. Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza City said it had received two bodies from the strike. Continue reading...
